The last ability will cause you to lose the game even if you somehow manage to have a life-total greater than 0 at the time the Lich is put into the graveyard or if some other effect would prevent you from losing for having 0 life. If, on the other hand, some effect such as that from Platinum Angel says that you can't lose the game then even the last ability of the Lich cannot cause you to do so. The ability will just resolve and the game will continue as normal.

cards.name: Lifeforce
cards.text: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.
cards.originalText: {G}{G}: Destroy a black spell as it is being cast. This use may be played as an interrupt, and does not affect black cards already in play.

cards.name: Lifelace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes green. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
cards.originalText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to green. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

cards.name: Lifetap
cards.text: Whenever a Forest an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: You gain 1 life each time any forest of opponent's becomes tapped.

rulings.text: Gives one life for each and every Forest tapped.
In multi-player games it affects all opponents.

cards.name: Lightning Bolt
cards.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: Lightning Bolt does 3 damage to one target.
printings: Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning

cards.name: Living Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Whenever you're dealt damage, put that many vitality counters on Living Artifact.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a vitality counter from Living Artifact. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: Put a counter on target artifact for each life you lose. During upkeep you may trade one counter for one life, but you can only trade in one counter each turn.

rulings.text: You can cast it targeting your opponent's artifacts. The controller of the Aura (not the controller of the artifact) controls the Living Artifact ability.
Does not trigger on loss of life, just on damage.

cards.name: Living Lands
cards.text: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.
cards.originalText: Treat all forests in play as 1/1 creatures. Now they can be enchanted, killed, and so forth, and they can be tapped either for mana or to attack. The living lands have no color; they are not considered green cards.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.name: Living Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}: Regenerate Living Wall.
cards.originalText: Counts as a wall. {1}: Regenerates.
cards.flavor: Some fiendish mage had created a horrifying wall of living flesh, patched together from a jumble of still-recognizable body parts. As we sought to hew our way through it, some unknown power healed the gaping wounds we cut, denying us passage.

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: Tap to add 1 green mana to your mana pool. This tap can be played as an interrupt.
cards.flavor: Whenever the Llanowar Elves gather the fruits of their forest, they leave one plant of each type untouched, considering that nature's portion.

cards.name: Lord of Atlantis
cards.text: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk.
cards.originalText: All Merfolk in play gain islandwalk and +1/+1 while this card is in play.
cards.flavor: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

cards.name: Lord of the Pit
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
Flying, trample
You must sacrifice one of your own creatures during upkeep or Lord of the Pit does 7 damage to you. You may still attack with Lord of the Pit even if you failed to sacrifice a creature.

rulings.text: You can select creatures with Protection from Black to be sacrificed.
If you have a creature, you must sacrifice it. The 7 damage can only be taken if no creature can be sacrificed.
If you have two Lords of the Pit, you can sacrifice them to each other.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
cards.originalText: All creatures able to block target creature must do so. If a creature has the ability to block more than one creature, Lure does not prevent this. If there is more than one attacking creature with Lure, defender may choose which of them each defending creature blocks.

rulings.text: Lure does not give a creature the ability to block the Lured creature, it just forces those creatures which are already able to block the Lured creature to do so.
If a Lured creature is in a band, only blockers able to block the Lured creature are affected by the Lure.
The opponent does not have to activate any abilities in an attempt to make his or her creatures block. More specifically, a cost to block of zero mana is an optional cost you can choose not to pay.

cards.name: Magical Hack
cards.text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.originalText: Change the text of any card being played or already in play by replacing one basic land type with another. For example, you can change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk."

rulings.text: Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.
You can't change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as "Island Fish Jasconius".

Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.
It can be used to change a land's type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn't change the name of any permanent.

cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.originalText: Flying
cards.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

cards.name: Mana Flare
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.
cards.originalText: Whenever either player taps land for mana, each land produces 1 extra mana of the appropriate type.

rulings.text: If the land produces more than one color of mana at a single time, its controller chooses which of those types is produced by Mana Flare's ability.
The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless.
When used with lands that can produce multiple colors, Mana Flare produces one additional mana of the same color that was produced. It can't give a mana of a color that wasn't produced.
Only produces extra mana when land is tapped for mana, not when tapped by some other effect.
Mana Flare adds one of whatever color the land produces after applying any land type or color changing effects.
This is a triggered mana ability.
Does not copy any restrictions on the mana, such as with Mishra's Workshop or Pillar of the Paruns.
Produces only one additional mana, regardless of how much was produced by tapping the land.

cards.name: Mana Short
cards.text: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.
cards.originalText: All opponent's lands are tapped, and opponent's mana pool is emptied.

rulings.text: Since this is an instant, your opponent may use instants in response to the casting of this spell. Note that such spells and abilities will be resolved before the mana pool is emptied by the Mana Short. This makes it useless as a countermeasure for spells. To use it effectively, you need to use it during Upkeep and even then it will not prevent the use of instant spells and abilities.
If you play Mana Short in response to a spell, it will have no effect on that spell since the mana has already been paid.
It even taps lands that do not produce mana.
